thread.title: Charlotte-Area High School Football Players of the Week
thread.title_full: Charlotte-Area High School Football Players of the Week

author:
Langston Wertz Jr. 
lwertz @charlotteobserver.com
title: Charlotte-Area High School Football Players of the Week
text:
Charlotte-Area High School Football Players of the Week 
Charlotte-area’s football players of the week. High school football player of the week video, 10.15.15 lwertz@charlotteobserver.com i Order Reprint of this Story 
Aapri Washington, Mountain Island Charter: In a 48-14 win over Hickory Grove, Washington ran 16 times for 402 yards and four touchdowns, believed to be a Gaston County rushing record. He averaged 25 yards per carry, turning in one of the top 50 performances in N.C. High School Athletic Association history . Washington also had eight tackles, two interceptions and a fumble recovery. 
Cade Carney, Davidson Day: Ran for two touchdowns, caught a touchdown pass, scored on a punt return and threw a scoring pass in his team’s wild 38-36 win at Charlotte Latin. He accounted for 306 yards total offense. Teammate Garrett Groulx had 14 tackles and three sacks. 
Austin Colonna, Marvin Ridge: 31-for-37 for 457 yards and four touchdowns in a win over Sun Valley. 
Chazz Surratt, East Lincoln: In a 48-24 win over Newton-Conover, Surratt ran 23 times for 282 yards and two scores. He completed 15-of-22 passes for 223 yards and three touchdowns. 
Luke Miller, Lake Norman: caught six passes for 222 yards in a 40-38 win over Alexander Central. He caught the game-winning 45-yard scoring pass from QB Hayden Carlson with 2:11 left. 
Langston Wertz Jr.
